review_title: I enjoyed working at Andrews University
job_title: Assistant Professor in Berrien Springs, MI
pros: Very cosmopolitan campus. There is an abundance of opportunity to learn from many cultures. The students are typically quite polite and cooperative. Campus is delightful.
cons: As a parochial school there is too much of what seems like cronyism and patronage. So many of the people are related if not by blood but by friendship. The pay is on the low side, however, I can understand why that is so and I am not overly concerned. Sometimes it seems as though decisions are made based on personality and not on principle.

review_title: Good place to work; great benefits; can be narrow-minded
job_title: Faculty in Berrien Springs, MI
pros: Great place to work with a wide variety of people--from different backgrounds. AU has a highly diverse student population, representing many, many countries. Also, the faculty and staff of the university reflect this population pretty well.
cons: It is a small, liberal arts, private school that is affiliated with the Seventh-day Adventist church. While there is a great deal of effort to be inclusive, the environment can be difficult to "live up to".

review_title: Not very Unique, but very structured
job_title: Assessment Systems Coordinator in Berrien Springs, MI
pros: Some of the best reasons to work at Andrews University is because it was close to home. It also was convenient and easy to step into any position as long as you have the skills
cons: There is too much backstabbing and fishbowl atmosphere.  I didn't appreciate how I just felt like a number and how I would never really grow or get promoted in the position I had. The administration does a lot of things under the table and really doesn't respect the qualities and skills it's employees have. They make rash decisions based on what they want and not what is best for the company.

job_title: Adjunct Instructor in Berrien Springs, MI
pros: Working at Andrews University is a pleasure. The campus is beautiful and it was refreshing to work in a Christian atmosphere. It is easy to establish collaborative relationships with coworkers.
cons: The biggest challenge for me was driving 45 minutes each way. On a part-time salary, I was living with relatives and couldn't afford to move closer to campus.

job_title: Student Chaplain in Dacula, GA
pros: Great supervisory team that always encouraged you and took to trusting you with your tasks without micromanaging. Family atmosphere that made me feel home.
cons: Finances were not always available to fulfill goals. Sometimes were limited to "plan b's" because of financial limitations that were frustrating.

job_title: Market Research Analyst in Berrien Springs, MI
pros: Great campus, generally nice people. Safe inexpensive area to live in. Benefits of a large school in a smaller package.
cons: There are some inexperienced, unqualified and generally disinterested in their job people here and there. Typical bureaucracy exists in certain areas.

job_title: Student Success Assistant in Berrien Springs, MI
pros: Everyone in the office was kind and genuine, the scheduling of work was based around my classes. They personally cared about my well being and gave me a lot of freedom to help out with most of the different sections of the student success department.
cons: there were none, There was cake on birthdays!

job_title: Dispatch Communication Officer in Berrien Springs, MI
pros: Great co-workers, supportive work environment, understanding/flexible uppermanagement
cons: Non-profit, private, christian university - doesn't pay as much as other places. No compensation for night/holiday workers at all. We get paid exactly what those with "normal" schedules do even thought it takes us away from family during critical family hours and on holidays. And it's hard to find good night people.
